MALAPPURAM

Malappuram is a district in the central part of Kerala, known for its cultural, religious, and natural diversity. It is a place where you can experience the heritage, festivals, and cuisine of Kerala, as well as enjoy the scenic hills, forests, and waterfalls. Here are some of the tourist attractions in Malappuram district that you can visit:

Kottakkunnu: This is a hill park and historical site located in Malappuram city. It offers a panoramic view of the city and the surrounding hills. It also has a water park, an adventure park, an art gallery, a 16D cinema, an open air theatre, and a balloon park. It is a perfect place for families and fun lovers

Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary: This is a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts. It is situated on a cluster of islands on the confluence of the Kadalundipuzha River and the Arabian Sea. It is home to over a hundred species of native birds and around 60 species of migratory birds. It also has a mangrove forest and a scenic beach

Nilambur Teak Museum: This is the first teak museum in the country and showcases the history, culture, and ecology of teak. It has a collection of information, articles, and documents related to teak, as well as a taxonomical garden, a butterfly garden, and a nature trail. It is a must-visit for anyone interested in learning more about this valuable wood

Adyanpara Waterfalls: This is a serene and less-explored waterfall located in Nilambur. It is surrounded by dense forest and has a natural pool at its base. It is a great spot for swimming, picnicking, and relaxing
